column4: hello I'm trying to get grub 2 to boot my xp drive my linux drive is the Master while the xp drive is the slave when I go to type update-grub I get this grub-probe: error: Cannot find a GRUB drive for /dev/sdb1.  Check your device.map.
Are you running update-grub from a LiveCD?
nope, but I install this system from one
I'm using Ubuntu 9.10 and its fully installed to my hard drive so its a full system
Try renaming /boot/grub/device.map so that grub creates one on the fly, like "sudo mv /boot/grub/device.map /boot/grub/device.map-bak"
hmm I didn't see a device map in there let me check
too many files so little time lol
Jordan_U_ its set to use sda but its on sdb its actually suppose to be on (hd1) /dev/sdb its showing (hd0) /dev/sda
Then renaming the file should work, device.map won't even be created by default in the next version of Ubuntu since it's not really needed any more.
Jordan_U_  thanks here let me share what I did I added (hd1) /dev/sdb to the file as well as the (hd0) /dev/sda and it worked and updated
Jordan_U_  Ok thanks again I'm going to see if this puppy will reboot to windows
